title: Reforming.
body:
So, it's been... 8ish? years since i've played League of Legends, with pauses and breaks here and there (Life. lol.). And recently (6-7?months? ago) I got my first ban (well, proper ban). Which i accepted and played through, i knew i was being an idiot. 

It's been 6-7months now, and i have FINALLY reached honor level 1 again (milestone 0). I haven't been chat-restricted or penalized in the slightest (i definitely have shut up in chat, thats for sure). 

This isn't so much as a complaint, as a query, Why does it take so long? I understand it's probably because i don't play as much as others? Full-time Job and all. 

I was really excited to see CLASH be introduced, and i had a huge feeling that it would follow the other game-types of "Honor-level2 requirement".
However with the current climbing of my honor.. i find that i wont be able to play Clash all year, which is kind of a bummer tbh. 

This thread is really just about asking a few questions:

 1. Why does it take so long? 

2. If i played 5x the amount of games, would i reach it faster?

 3. shouldn't 6-7months be enough to show reformation? Especially on an 8year-old account that was previously unbanned? 

tl;dr. 6-7months of reformation, still honor level 1 (milestone 0), why is it taking so long to climb?

replies.body:
I don't know bro, I was honour 5 all last season and I'm currently honour 3 now (and climbing).

It's not hard, if you just curb your hatred for morons (I know many bans are provoked, and the provocateur is never  punished).
